intro: Portulaca massaica, commonly known as moss rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid conditions. Portulaca massaica is also known for its short blooming period, typically lasting from summer to early autumn.
